item.title: Ubuntu on Hyper-V
item.description: Getting Ubuntu to run on Hyper-V was a bit of an issue for Windows Server 2008, here are some things to look for. In the boot menu, add vga16fb.modeset=0 to the boot options by hitting F6 to disable framebuffer mode that is really slow under Hyper-V. Do normal install, don’t worry about the red “can’t find network issue”. Enable the Hyper-V modules: echo "hv_vmbus" >> /etc/initramfs-tools/modules echo "hv_storvsc" >> /etc/initramfs-tools/modules echo "hv_blkvsc" >> /etc/initramfs-tools/modules echo "hv_netvsc" >> /etc/initramfs-tools/modules update-initramfs –u Disable Framebuffer (otherwise the text screen scrolls by like a 9600 modem)
